definition:
A [**non-zero vector**]{} in a vector space $V$ is a vector that is not
equal to the zero vector in $V$.

If $\mathbf{u}$ is a non-zero vector in $V$ and $a$ is a scalar, i.e. an
element of the field over which $V$ is defined, then the equation
$a\mathbf{u} = \mathbf{0}$ is possible only in the case $a = 0$.
